isis.stitle: FULL POWER HYDRAULIC ABS BRAKE SYSTEM - GENERAL DESCRIPTION

svcsubsecinfo.para: The Full Power Brake System is a stored energy, hydraulic brake system which integrates the functions of brake actuation, ABS, and traction control (optional), into one unit, referred to as the Hydraulic Compact Unit (HCU). A small master cylinder attached to the brake pedal linkage produces signal pressure in proportion to driver demand for braking. This signal pressure is sent to the relay valve of the HCU which delivers brake fluid to the foundation brakes in proportion to the signal. The following features of this system are covered in this manual.

item.para: Carry-over foundation brakes (Bosch pin slide type).

Electronic Brakeforce Distribution (EBD). System identifies front to rear wheel slip imbalances due to axle loading and distributes braking forces in proportion to axle loading to render a balanced brake application on the vehicle.
ABS prevents wheel lockup during braking.
During braking, the system monitors each wheel, and reacts to any potential lockup by modulating the brake pressure for the affected wheel.

Recording of brake system operations. Memory within the ECU circuitry maintains a record of brake system operations. These operational records may be used to more efficiently schedule preventive maintenance. Examples of some of what is recorded:
number of service brake applies identified as: 'light to moderate', 'moderate to hard', and 'hard to extreme'
Automatic Traction Control (ATC) with J1939 engine management
ATC prevents wheel spin during acceleration.
During acceleration, the system monitors the wheel speeds, and may react to any loss of traction by applying a limited braking force to the affected wheel, without driver intervention.
If both drive wheels begin to spin, the ATC system sends a signal to the engine to reduce engine torque and allow the drive wheels to regain traction.
Dash mounted Traction Control switch, allows two levels of traction control to be selected (Normal Traction Control or Mud and Snow mode).
